channel.title: Answered, thank you arr0w and the un-named
channel.description:
Ok, can someone tell me about includes
1) How do they work, I know how to install, and things, but i'm interested to making my own :rolleyes:
2) How does the script "call" things from include, like
[scar] program bla;
{.include example.scar}
procedure something;
Do_Something_What_Is_In_Include
[/scar] So, I mean, i have not told the script, what "Do_something..." is, example
(NO) [scar] var do_something_what_is_in_include:boolean; [/scar]
If, i haven't done that, to script, it says; "unknown "something" in script (line:something)blahblahblah."
But, If I put an include, what has that, does the script know that that is boolean? I know, i did not make any sense, but if you managed to read into here, and you don't know what i mean,
[size=50pt]HOW DOES INCLUDES WORK?[/size]
Thank you.

item.title: Answered, thank you arr0w and the un-named
item.dc:creator: @arr0w Arr0w
item.description:
@arr0w wrote:

thanks weibs for correecting me

Read full topic
item.source: Answered, thank you arr0w and the un-named

for includes you can’t rip stuff you have to make them yourself

item.title: Answered, thank you arr0w and the un-named
item.dc:creator: @Jei_Jei_KK Jei Jei KK
item.description:
@Jei_Jei_KK wrote:

So, basically, if i put .includes procedure name, eg.
[scar]
//This is include
procedure something;
blah.
end.[/scar]
Something, to my script, eg.
[scar]
program eek;
something;
end.
[/scar]
It does “blah.?”

Read full topic
item.source: Answered, thank you arr0w and the un-named

item.title: Answered, thank you arr0w and the un-named
item.dc:creator: @arr0w Arr0w
item.description:
@arr0w wrote:

Yea say if you added a really long procedure like procedure Randoms;
people put it in a include so all you need to do is type Randoms; and it will do all the stuff thats in the include.

Read full topic
item.source: Answered, thank you arr0w and the un-named

item.title: Answered, thank you arr0w and the un-named
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

Say the include ‘example’ has the following procedure:

procedure WriteLol;
begin
Writeln(‘lol’);
end;

To call it you would just use “WriteLol;”.

Read full topic
item.source: Answered, thank you arr0w and the un-named

item.title: Answered, thank you arr0w and the un-named

item.description:
@Jei_Jei_KK wrote:

Ok, can someone tell me about includes

  1. How do they work, I know how to install, and things, but i’m interested to making my own :rolleyes:

  2. How does the script “call” things from include, like

[scar]
program bla;

{.include example.scar}

procedure something;

Do_Something_What_Is_In_Include

[/scar]
So, I mean, i have not told the script, what “Do_something…” is, example

(NO)
[scar]
var
do_something_what_is_in_include:boolean;
[/scar]

If, i haven’t done that, to script, it says; “unknown “something” in script (line:something)blahblahblah.”

But, If I put an include, what has that, does the script know that that is boolean?
I know, i did not make any sense, but if you managed to read into here, and you don’t know what i mean,

[size=50pt]HOW DOES INCLUDES WORK?[/size]

Thank you.
